description: Blastococcus haudaquaticus is a species of bacteria that belongs to the genus Blastococcus. It is a Gram-positive, aerobic, and non-spore-forming coccoid bacterium. Blastococcus haudaquaticus is typically found in terrestrial environments, such as soil, and is not typically associated with aquatic habitats. The cells of this species are spherical or ovoid in shape and can occur singly or in pairs. Blastococcus haudaquaticus is capable of growing at a wide range of temperatures, from mesophilic to moderately thermophilic conditions. This species is considered an environmental bacterium and has not been associated with any known human or animal diseases.
